channel.title: Google Chrome Overtakes Internet Explorer
channel.description:
http://www.pcworld.com/article/255886/google_chrome_overtakes_internet_explorer.html
Google’s Chrome is now the most popular Web browser worldwide, surpassing Microsoft’s Internet Explorer for the first time, according to the latest figures from StatCounter. After years of slowly chipping away Internet Explorer’s market share, Chrome took the lead with 32.76 percent share, while IE dipped to 31.94 percent.

item.title: Google Chrome Overtakes Internet Explorer
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

They have commercials for the new IE, so something must have had an attempt made at it, making it awesome enough for said commercials.

Read full topic

item.title: Google Chrome Overtakes Internet Explorer
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

with IE i feel like im looking out an open window and at any moment it might slam shut and break my neck

Read full topic

item.title: Google Chrome Overtakes Internet Explorer
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

Chrome boots much faster than Firefox, part of it is my fault but it’s still annoying. The only downside is that some school sites only work with IE, but that’s part of the idiocy of my school.

With IE you get the feeling of being vulnerable to malware, whether that feeling is justified or not.

Read full topic

item.title: Google Chrome Overtakes Internet Explorer
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

Agree on the last part. The biggest reason I prefer Chrome is that, I use multiple operating systems daily and Chrome is consistently good across them all. Firefox is shit on OSX, but Chrome is fantastic on OSX, Windows and Linux (which I use at Uni on the odd machines that haven’t been upgraded from XP to Win7) and synchronising across them all is part of why I prefer to use one browser for all the different platforms.

Read full topic

item.title: Google Chrome Overtakes Internet Explorer
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

IE9 is a large improvement, in that the interface is much cleaner and it can actually render some html5 and css3 elements (still not half as many as chrome or ff though). Give IE10 a try too, I believe it’s available now for download in the early stages, comes standard with Windows 8 Release Candidate anyway.

I’m a Chrome fan, I like that everything is just synced nicely with my account, bookmarks can be loaded onto my college computers using my account in under 5 seconds. Also found it to be the fastest, both in terms of page load times and application load times. I use some of the Firefox extensions occasionally though and they’re good.

Read full topic

item.title: Google Chrome Overtakes Internet Explorer
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

This. Also Ive been using Firefox far more then Chrome since it’s the default browser on most of the Linux distros I run… Ive never had a problem with either Chrome or Firefox, but I must say good job to Google for beating Microsoft. Must be the reason I see IE ads on my tv all the time…

Read full topic

item.title: Google Chrome Overtakes Internet Explorer
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

It’s funny when I bought my laptop, I just never bothered to download another browser. I got used to ie9 real fast, and it’s been a year(?) now and no complaints really.

Which says a lot imo because it wasn’t long ago whenever I’d use IE i’d end up with trojans and virus’ from exploits on pages or even ads.

Read full topic

item.title: Google Chrome Overtakes Internet Explorer
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

Don’t IE6 and 7 pretty much try and force you to upgrade anyways? Those users tend to be the ones that have no idea what they’re doing, I don’t think the Google circle changing would affect that large a percent of that client base that use those outdated clients. Also personally haven’t used IE9 yet, but the IT director at SPU told me at our barbeque that it was pretty decent

Read full topic

item.title: Google Chrome Overtakes Internet Explorer
item.dc:creator: @vManlyMan vManlyMan
item.description:
@vManlyMan wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:18, topic:442876”][quote author=Mopman link=topic=545561.msg4002453#msg4002453 date=1338216230]
What IE stuff? IE9 is actually a very standard compliant browser, and IE6 is dead as a dodo?
[/quote]

I haven’t messed with IE9 yet, I’m sure it’s an improvement. But unfortunately many people still use IE6 and 7.[/quote]

Youtube is ending support for IE7 soon, so I’d assume so is all of Google’s other things. (Gmail, Docs, etc.) So they’re pretty much forcing people to upgrade.

Read full topic

item.title: Google Chrome Overtakes Internet Explorer
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:15, topic:442876”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=545561.msg4002095#msg4002095 date=1338162794]
This is great for the internet as a whole, since now crappy developers can’t try to excuse writing code that only works in IE.
[/quote]

Actually, these days I see much more Mozilla specific JS/CSS than IE specific.[/quote]

Generally that is standards-specified though, meaning it runs in chrome well too. The IE specific stuff only works on IE and will ever only work on IE.

Read full topic

item.title: Google Chrome Overtakes Internet Explorer
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Moparisthebest:

This is great for the internet as a whole, since now crappy developers can’t try to excuse writing code that only works in IE.

Actually, these days I see much more Mozilla specific JS/CSS than IE specific.

Read full topic

item.title: Google Chrome Overtakes Internet Explorer
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

This is great for the internet as a whole, since now crappy developers can’t try to excuse writing code that only works in IE.

However, at the firefox v chrome debate, I still often try to use chrome, and I simply don’t like it as well as firefox. Also, I do see how chrome uses more memory, since it spawns a separate process for each tab, and each process inevitably has overhead that firefox doesn’t have. There is no way around that.

Read full topic

item.title: Google Chrome Overtakes Internet Explorer
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

You also have to consider how add-ons and extensions affect performance beyond the vanilla product.

Read full topic

item.title: Google Chrome Overtakes Internet Explorer
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“Taharok, post:11, topic:442876”][quote author=eczema3 link=topic=545561.msg3999132#msg3999132 date=1337713866]

I just went back to firefox a week ago. Google chrome uses far too much memory on Ubuntu 11.10 when the system only has 1GB ram. Firefox uses less ram with 10 tabs open than Google chrome with one tab.

that’s so backwards
[/quote]

This. Chrome should be using a lot less memory, unless you have like flash running. The only memory problem I’ve ever had with chrome was flash, which isn’t chrome at all of course. I usually average 30-40 tabs and chrome doesn’t use more than 1gb of memory, on a machine with 8gb available. I think that says enough. :P[/quote]

depends on the builds compared but they use about the same memory provided no leaks

Read full topic

item.title: Google Chrome Overtakes Internet Explorer
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“eczema3, post:7, topic:442876”][quote author=runescape3dude link=topic=545561.msg3998963#msg3998963 date=1337671362]
I just went back to firefox a week ago. Google chrome uses far too much memory on Ubuntu 11.10 when the system only has 1GB ram. Firefox uses less ram with 10 tabs open than Google chrome with one tab.
[/quote]
that’s so backwards[/quote]

This. Chrome should be using a lot less memory, unless you have like flash running. The only memory problem I’ve ever had with chrome was flash, which isn’t chrome at all of course. I usually average 30-40 tabs and chrome doesn’t use more than 1gb of memory, on a machine with 8gb available. I think that says enough.

Read full topic
